newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Princess Di reprimands spokesman.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Princess Di reprimands spokesman.

text.p: Princess Diana reprimanded a member of her staff and sacked him as an official spokesman on Friday after he told a newspaper she was furious with her children's former nanny, Tiggy Legge-Bourke.
The ex-wife of heir to the throne Prince Charles took the action after her staff conducted an investigation into a story in the top-selling Sun tabloid.

"The Princess discovered that The Sun had accurately reported the official's remarks about Miss Tiggy Legge-Bourke but his comments did not, in fact, reflect the Princess's own opinions," the Sun and lawyers Mishcon de Reya said in a joint statement.
"The member of staff will no longer act as an official spokesman for Diana, The Princess of Wales," the statement, which did not name the staff member, added.

The Sun had reported that the Princess was angry with Legge-Bourke for joining her 14-year-old son, Prince William, on a picnic during parents' day at Eton, Britain's most prestigious private school at which he is a pupil.
Prince Charles and Princess Diana both stayed away from the event for fear that the publicity surrounding their visit might spoil the occasion for other pupils and their families.
The Sun quoted the Princess as saying of Legge-Bourke, who also used to look after her younger son Prince Harry: "She has made an idiot of herself publicly."
According to London's Evening Standard, the Princess was "more than pleased" that Legge-Bourke had been able to join her son at Eton.
